oMdJBrgCOfGKbJ1N2P23pA.text: Lovely place to celebrate National Pie Week.  Thanks for the rec Yelp!  A friend and I piled into the cute white tile lined downstairs shop in the Market. They have a great selection of British pies and puddings. We sidled up to the counter, put in our request, learned that mashed generally comes with pie, and ordered that as well.  Service was very friendly and prompt. We did one goat cheese and squash pie and one steak and ale pie and liked them both a lot. They probably could have been a tad bit warmer and tastier, but we're in Britain, right ? ;) Overall the experience was a great one for good quality food, very reasonable prices (5 GBP per pie), and nice ambiance. Also a convenient location right in the heart of Covent Garden. Cheers!

ebUEIoAH2wlCEXAPZYcBwQ.text: I visited Battersea Pie Station recently to try their Christmas special, a reindeer pie called The Rudolph: londonist.com/2010/12/re…  It was really good, very filling and perfect for a wintry afternoon meal. I'd be inclined to return for the reindeer pie or another non-Yuletide option, especially considering the prices were decent and that I'm in the Covent Garden area all the time. It's in the heart (lower ground) of Covent Garden Market. So, super convenient but a bit touristy (or at least you'll have to plow through a few of 'em on the way into the pie shop). I reckon it's worth dealing with the out of towners for some yummy pie in a central setting.

0DMRwaDuTCiu7DMer1a78A.text: I stopped in this place because they had open seats, a decent selection, and it was heated. The prices were a bit steep, but the portions were generous. I had the beef and onion pie because it had just come fresh out of the oven and a side of creamy mash, both with gravy. The crust was plenty flaky and very crispy. The potatoes were smooth and the gravy did not disappoint. They give you your own gravy boat so you can decide if you meal is swimming or drowning in the stuff. If you don't want to eat in, the prices drop about a pound or so and you can eat as you mill about the rest of Covent Garden.

VC-zlq0dFb3RxV_L2XgpqA.text: Wow what a great little restaurant, neatly hidden away in the depths of Covent Garden market.We stumbled upon this place a few days ago and instantly fell in love with it, the staff were so friendly and the food was amazing.Its so nice to see a company showing Covent Garden tourists some Great British Food!Will be back again.....

3kK2YSBbnuF-WXK9ZUp3Iw.text: A friend was visiting London for one day only, and so we had a whirlwind tour culminating in a night at the Royal Ballet.  Desperate to find her some traditional English food, we wandered into several overbooked West End eateries before heading to the basement of Covent Garden Market. As a vegetarian architect, she loved both the butternut squash & goat cheese pie as well as the adorable interior design of the space. The mash and gravy were both delicious, and I will definitely be back to try the lamb & rosemary pie. Minus one star because the potato & leek soup was below average... but that's what I get for ordering anything but pie in a pie shop!

9t-AZERHyYHDE4_rwfpj_g.text: We needed a something to hold us over till dinner and this fit the bill perfectly.  We all loved the pies - beef, chicken & mushroom and beef & kidney.

pnYvJeeLxZ1V9z8RXFeCsg.text: This place was really good! I definitely don't think it deserves only 3 stars for the quality v. quantity v. cost.I ordered the butternut squash and goat cheese pie and it was absolutely delicious. Rich but not too greasy, flaky crust, good amount of cheese, onion, potato and squash. Both my friend and I really enjoyed the flavor, and it comes with free red wine gravy. My friend ordered the steak and cheese pie, which she said wasn't quite as good. Therefore, it's a great place for vegetarians! They also have a "pie of the day" which was chili "quorne" carne which was vegetarian and filled with fake meat, kidney beans and corn. I wanted to try it, but the butternut squash just called to me!It was only 4 pounds for takeout, and with mashed potatoes it came out to 5.15 pounds for my friend. I definitely recommend this place, and you can eat at the cute tables outside in the courtyard. Highly recommend this place for a quick, filling and reasonably priced meal in Covent Gardens!

rV8_3Cf0DEptc5BsWNqAOg.text: Very tasty meat/stout pie.  Very affordable as well, This was up on the list for me to try as a cheap eat and it didn't disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom

S668vhms7i0bsxlWcpID_w.text: Absolutely delicious! The butternut squash and goat's cheese pie is incredible! A++ would recommend. Best thing I've eaten in weeks! Yum yum yum

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Butternut squash and goat's cheese pie with a side of spinach feta and garden peas salad

31VDBPmK6wFK_HeWRMA3_Q.text: This little place was so cozy and so British. I loved it. The atmosphere is teeny, tiny ,but I feel like it mimics a little Inn, so the right squeeze didn't bother me. There isn't a ton of extra room in Covet Garden! Anyways, the menu featured a variety of savory pies, served cold or hot along with perfect mash. I loved the trendy-ness of the place, and I feel like the food actually lived up to the atmosphere. I ordered the mini or baby butternut squash and goat cheese pie with mash which was absolutely divine. The flavor combination and flaky crust were stellar and unforgettable. This was my favorite meal out of my London trip. Everything also tasted fresh and real, right down to the gravy. I wish this was a more popular food option in America! If you love in London or are visiting, please treat yourself to a hearty meal at this establishment. It will not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Mini Butternut squash and goat cheese pie

ya58s1W6-40qHkS91rGZUg.text: My partner and I showed up at the Pie Shop this Saturday hoping to enjoy pie and mash, despite the tourist trap nature of the establishment (Eating at the pie shop is akin to shopping at Harrods, riding the London eye and taking a picture at Big Ben, minus any semblance of grandeur or class).When we got there, we ordered the following:1) Fish baby pie2) Chicken and Mushroom pie3) Red Onion and cheese PastieWe were very careful to ensure that all 3 pies were indeed available by pointing to them in the display counter when we ordered and confirming this with Matt (the assistant manager, who we assumed was a server)We then happily sat at our table awaiting our order when, not 5 minutes after we had ordered, Matt approached us and told us that our Fish mini pie had sold out. Surprised, we asked how that was possible as we had ordered and confirmed that the pie was available. We were told that the error was on Mat's part and he offered us a vegetarian option, which was not what we wanted. Around 2 minutes later, a female Eastern European server approached our table and apologized profusely because she gave the last Red onion pastie, the one we had ordered, to another customer who had ordered after we had. When we looked for Matt, he was in the opposite corner of the establishment, looking away. Perhaps this was because, like before, we had confirmed that the toastie was available by visually pointing it out to him. And again we were offered pie options that we did not want, mixed with apologies that felt forced and lacked any sincerity. I immediately asked for a partial refund, which was given. When I asked to speak to the manager, Mark Hudson, I was told that he was not available. When an establishment cares so little about their customer, one can't help but wonder if its design meant only to milk tourists and passers by, with no regard for its reputation and service.

ZjulKK8p9jhPcuN6iY96CA.text: This tiny hidden place is like a little precious gem in Convent Garden. The decor is really cute, fresh and modern. The pies are really really good! The sauce is just amazing and even the pies are good! You cannot get it wrong if you go there. Prices? Yes, they are high. But they are high everywhere in London, right? So, rathen spend your money here...

BmDk0Aa75QRZ8k_gv9hz9Q.text: Nice gem in an area with tons of tourist traps. Great spot to grab a snack to go or sit down for lunch. I had the minced beef and onion pie with potatoes and gravy. The gravy was spectacular with lots of herbs and great flavor. Would recommend to check it out if shopping in the market.

tfSupoJoTAD4Dall9yHtFA.text: Perfect way to experience British pies at this awesome little shop. We had the chicken mushroom pie with the curly kale, some wine and beer and it was a great light lunch. Fun environment inside the covent garden marketplace too!

JKw96jNVHQfH3aelI-6nmw.text: A small place with very good pies.  We tried the butternut squash and steak and stout and both were great.

52pmle8xxVi70YqVvWzeXQ.text: Battersea Pie is more on the side of fast-food pie than gourmet pie despite a very pretty interior. I had the Winstone pie which is the ever popular steak and kidney pie. I really liked the crust as it was flakey and fluffy so in my opinion, the pastry was very well done.  However, the filling was lacking. Couldn't find much kidney or steak and when I did, I thought it tasted like slightly overdone meat. I also had the cole slaw though and it was really good. It isn't a light cole slaw  as it was a bit heavy with mayo but sometimes that's exactly the type of cole slaw to hit the spot!As I said, ambience was very nice. Dim lighting with both large tables and stools for one-person diners aligning the wall. Overall good place to go for a cheap lunch and hearty meal, just don't expect gourmet pies :)

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Coleslaw with beef/kidney pie

w7KBe2WcCUtHOhOfNPl9mg.text: Had the chicken and mushroom pie and it was excellent, I paired with a unexpectedly delicious coleslaw. Everything was great! a go to place

yEq83FRnD35YpUQ_L8DhjA.text: Love it. My favorite pie spot in London. I like the chicken and mushroom pie with a side of peas.  Then just have whatever dessert the are slinging, cause it will be delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and mushroom pie.

3i4VLzbveVtETolTFQuhiw.text: Obsessed! I was so afraid I wouldn't get to try any British fare because of my vegetarianism, but this place solved my dilemma. Their butternut squash and goat cheese pie became my new favorite food! I tried pies from both shops, take-away and eat-in and while Camden was a fun outdoor eating experience in the market I preferred the Covent Garden shop. The mini pie is usually enough with a side. My friend also got the chicken pie and said it was to die for! I'm a fan of mash and beans but all the sides are great. Show up early, though, because they run out of pies quickly! They also deliver to certain areas of London!

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Take-away vegetarian pie and mash

-kasSt7OQswNeYzG9RJhsQ.text: I got the small fish pie with side mash (mashed potato). I thought they were both good, but real no WoW factor anywhere. I kinda wish the pie was a bit bigger and the mash was a bit smaller though. What can I expect from a place like this though... Oh, and they have two different prices... one for eat in and one for take out.

9gUPiVKeFZSHuGdzVztVHQ.text: Wait - steak and what?  KIDNEY?!  I'll take two.In the States the word "pie" is an exclusive reserve for the dessert kind - cherry pie, apple pie, coconut pie. The only exception to this rule is Shepard's Pie.  The Colman's mustard paired extremely well with the steak and kidney, offsetting the heavy game-y flavor of the kidney.  A job well done on the butternut squash and goat cheese pie as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom

2MSnN6C01kz76sqoHkfTcg.text: While on our way to the Shake Shake I looked down and saw this place so I made the decision to try it instead and that was the right call.We started with a spinach, feta and pea salad.  Such a nice dish on a warm day. We opted to try 3 pies, chicken, steak and butternut squash.  All were worth it!  OH and we also got mashed potatoes with gravy - DELISH! Very inviting interior as well - such a fun unique place.

hmye7ezWN9-JWNm5WfxaWw.text: For those that know me well, you understand my love of pie. You will be able to imagine my excitement at unearthing a new specialist pie store. Battersea Pie looks very pretty tucked away in the depth of Covent Garden Market. You can eat in at the cute little tables but I wanted mine to go. There are seven types of pie on offer, but I'd already decided the fate of The Winstone (Steak & Kidney). I'll admit I initially baulked at the excessive £4.50 price tag, £5 if you eat in. You can get sides of mash, beans, peas etc... for between £2.75 to £1. You can ask for herb & red wine gravy for free.So... to the pie. Just me, the pastry and the meaty goodness. For £4.50 would my expectations be met. No. In fact I was gutted. This was a soft pastry pie. Where was my slight crunch as I bit through the pastry? There was none. Where were my chunks of steak & kidney? They were hard to find. I cannot tell you how bitterly disappointed I was. I have recently come across some sensational pie shops, and was eager to add Battersea Pie to this honoured list. They are by no means bad, but they fall well short of what I'd expect for a £4.50 pie.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom

3814MF_QE_9HAo8cDQ_2qA.text: Decent option if you are looking for a cheap eat in an area where you can easily fall into a substandard tourist trap. The service was friendly and quick. The pies themselves had a nice golden crust but the pastry underneath was maybe a bit too stodgy for me. I asked for steak and ale and my partner had the Winstone (steak and kidney) but when they came they were both the same and definitely had kidney in. I ate some of it anyway but being a bit squeamish about offal it did put me off - although the steak itself was tasty!

hnsrnnXFKCkKlwpVuKvl7w.text: Cute concept. Nice ambienceNot the best pies i've ever had...but it was good. I had the Steak & Guiness pie with creamed mash. Resonable prices. It wasn't very busy on Sunday...which was shocking to me

p_CWK-WsgL-w5jyuxSNJ6w.text: After seeing this place in Covent Garden on previous trips to London we finally caved and tried it a few weeks ago...and we loved it so much that we decided to go back again before we left. The pies are really good, especially the steak and stout, and prices are so reasonable for being in such a touristy area. Service is quick, although the atmosphere isn't great if you can't grab one of the few tables out in the piazza. The inside is very very small and it tends to get quite crowded, so you may have to squish into the counter table on the side which isn't the most pleasant. This doesn't change my opinion at all though, and I'll definitely come back on my next trip to the area.

yZf3B-ALMMEO-uM5BzV2Hg.text: I am unequivocally head-over-heels in love with Battersea Pie. Yes, it's in a prime tourist area (Covent Garden) and yes, that means the prices are slightly inflated in an already pocketbook-busting, expensive city; but the pies and pastys here are DELICIOUS!This is my go-to pie shop whenever I am in London. I love it. I dream about it. I get excited the second I step off the plane in the U.K. I love everything about this cute little pie shop -- the friendly employees, the adorable decor, and most of all the tasty, tasty pies. I've sampled almost every item on the entire menu and I've not had a dud yet. Everything has been delicious: hot with a flaky crust and freshly prepared. My favorite menu item is the (surprise!) vegetarian cheese, spinach and onion pasty. I also adore the baby fish pie. My husband gets the steak and stout pie with an extra side of gravy (which comes in an adorable baby gravy boat). Note that the dining room area is super tiny and is woefully inadequate for the restaurant. Consider yourself lucky if you are able to dine in and don't have to takeaway. If I had to create a can't-miss foodie tour of London, Battersea Pie would top my list.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Munched-on pasty.
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Adorable full size pie, perfect for one hungry person.
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Designer Diet Coke cans.

Jszp6LLI4RFUcX0JFyFljw.text: Excellent local food, pie, and great service... try the sticky toffee pudding. Good location too! It's a very hidden gem. Try the beef vegetable pie.

myX2kTVtg_6muGb8jrVl2Q.text: We were really impressed with these pies! We tried the minced beef and onion and the chicken and mushroom. We all had a side of mashed potatoes with beef gravy, and green beans which were really fresh,and seasoned well. Tried a brownie for dessert and it was moist and chocolaty perfect to go with my tea. It was a tiny place tucked under the stairs but bright and modern due to the decor. It was a warm and filling meal on a chilly day.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Minced beef and mashed potatoes

c-IJ5nils3MqWx2HtsEXbg.text: I met a friend here for lunch before heading over to the Strand for some musical action. It's a very small shop with some indoor and outdoor seating as well as take-out options.I ordered the butternut squash and goat cheese pie with a side of green beans and it was delicious! The pie had a thick crust and a delicately flavoured filling while the beans were still a bit crunchy and just lightly buttered, everything taste fantastic! We were also given a vegetarian gravy, which was also quite tasty.The staff were very nice and service was quick. The only reason I'm not giving five stars is because there really isn't enough seating and the stools we sat on were quite wobbly and uncomfortable. Other than that, I'd definitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Time for pie!

6AQbsE_uRNYVbwk-C_sqMw.text: Delicious pies hidden away from the hungry tourists in Covent Garden! In the lower level of Covent Garden market, somewhere in a corner of the patio, you will find this tiny cosy place serving a variety of fresh prepared pies. If you are new to the so British meaty pies, you should definately try them here. As for the prices, I would say that are reasonable considering the quality and the location of this place.

vF17Etr8FLbEmG5pp6iuaA.text: Great meat pies, and the price is right. If you are looking for a bit of original British food, this is the place to go. Completely recommended.

wpLWwdcDzVrDBv1_p7ZW5g.text: The stop off during the Breakaway Bike Tour of London.Recommended by Heath; our guide.I had the Seafood pie; it was excellent!They have a few outside table and do take away as well.

f6lAWv5w_guVWiNw0o4UKQ.text: This was the first thing I ate after a red eye to London. I walked about 15-20 Min to this spot after checking into my hotel. I was determined to find me some local British food. This really hit the spot. It's a small, but popular spot. It was busy, but I was able to find a spot to eat. I got the minced beef and onion pie. It was piping hot and so delicious. It made me feel much better after having flown and walked to find good food. The restaurant is situated in Covent Garden, where there's many shops, local entertainment, and other restaurants to explore. I wish I had a chance during my stay in London to go explore that area some more.

Rb8WHQNWYLbIfUsNKXdLpA.text: A cute pie shop in Covent Garden! I had the chicken and mushroom pie with a coleslaw side. The side was actually bigger than the pie, I couldn't finish :p the pie was great!! Would love to go back to try the other onesThe prices are a little cheaper to take away (a pound or something like that), but if you can find a place to sit, the atmosphere is nice and casual.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Outside the shop. There some seating space outside too
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. The menu

eNgpdjnueroMigdzXDazmA.text: Comforting & savory!The Covent Garden can be madness and after trying to get a seat at a few other restaurants, my husband & I found this small place tucked under the stairs. They had an assortment of pies & I got the Butternut Squash & Goat Cheese Pie with a side of Baked Beans. Savory goodness! The buttery, flaky crust with the squash & goat cheese was an unexpected, amazing match. The Baked Beans were a great complement adding a little sweetness to my meal. The pies are only around £4.50 to £6 & the sides were £1.50 to £4. Quick & comforting meal that left my tummy full & happy. Our wallet was also full & happy. :PHeads up! It's cheaper for take out than eat in. Also, sides can be huge! My husband's sides were bigger than the pie itself.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Butternut Squash & Goat Cheese Pie! Great, unexpected combo! Also, a side of Baked Beans.

oQ--JELbZjhF31ATcuLMpQ.text: The food was good. Me and my boyfriend both got the pork pies and we liked them. The crust was flakey and they spiced them really well. The place is kept pretty clean and it was kept nice and cool( we went to London and caught a heat wave so it was 80 while we were there.) We didn't stay to long because they were closing in 20.

I8Z6jUZRFhU8bPUaH5X32w.text: One of the pride and joys of a sad nation; the very humble pie. The one burden with the responsibility to warm up the tummies of a nation with cold tummies. To provide comfort for the many who have to endure the endless onslaught of dark(sunless) skies and even darker clouds.Everyday seems like a great day for pie here in this frigid 10 Celsius weather in days of early June; "summer is here at last!!" or so that's how they've labelled it.This pie is warm but no quite warm enough. The crust is flaky but only to be upset by the chewy under-cooked inner half of the crust. That filling is mundane and unimaginative at best. Chicken is stringy if not rather tasteless at the same time. But that gravy in the filling is almost gold; salty and sweet with the perfect slightly gelatinous consistency.Far from the best pie I have had in my time but I would say it's one up your local supermarket pie.

zU0adzyNX0KQC-AEBSlWVQ.text: This is a small place located on the bottom floor of busy Covent Garden. I read about this place from TimeOut London so I decided to try it out for lunch during my trip to the UK. They have a reasonable number of pie selections and sides. I went with the classic Chicken and Mushroom pie. I found a solo seating area in this tiny place and dined in. The pie was flaky, meat was flavorful, and that small jug of gravy was heaven. Initially I didn't pour much gravy, but I ended up pouring the entire thing near the end because it is tasty. Like another reviewer mentioned, I do wish the pie's were hotter. It seemed to come warm. Overall, great place to check out at least once.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and Mushroom pie with gravy on the side. Soo yummy.

8YgY3FkGcc7SfBLXfIiqpw.text: Went here for the first time on national Pie day. Very delicious hot pies. They had 5 choice if fillings and I tried the beef and also the butternut squash and cheese. Both were fantastic. It's a small place, but we sat in and had a beer as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom

-t_qP3JXBWhyrDjdyzmO-g.text: If you want a decent piping hot homemade pie at a reasonable price then visit Battersea Pie in Covent Garden.  So many different pies to choose from.  You can eat inside or outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom

QTvVlKS9WM5w4CsPdL8GkQ.text: Delicious, freshly made pies, yummy mash. Not the super-Duper traditional East End variety but - when in need, a satisfying option.

XdSVwFpx08LRELa-cvQ5Jg.text: What: The best cheap meal on the Plaza.How much: Pies are around £5 (prices vary according to what you get, and also if you eat in or take it away). £10 should be more than enough for a very filling, satisfying lunch of pie, mash, gravy etc...Covent garden has been near the top of my absolute favourite places in London since the first time I went there back in 2011. I tend to hate touristy places, especially when they're really crowded, but there's something about Covent Garden I simply can't resist.As for most heavily touristy places, food is still a bit meh around there though. And/Or rather expensive. But, as for any general rules, there are always exception and I think I've found Covent Garden's!Battersea Pie's shop is a tiny unassuming shop located on the lower level of Covent Garden's Plaza. And it's most definitely the best value-for-money meal around!The whole place is pretty simple. It's all white tiles, marble-like tables and wooden stools. Plus all the necessary condiments. Which is perfectly fine by me (for some reason, I rather like this no-fuss look).But what I like even more are the pies, that are really quickly brought to your table by one of the lovely, always smilling members of staff. From then on, it becomes really difficult to resist the urge to dive in. Don't even try, just gave in to buttery, flaky pastry encasing the most moreish mince beef and onion filling. Hot, salty and very satisfying, there isn't much more to ask from a pie, is there?

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Mince Meat & Onion pie, Battersea Pie

5OqYJF6aIPcTQemsMzu_3A.text: Good food & good prices. I had the chicken & mushroom pie with spinach feta & garden pea salad...so good

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Batterea Pie Shop, really good food

dysUqMix-7qld66V51MRtg.text: Just the thing on a cloudy afternoon for a family of five. Had the chicken and mushroom pie, which really hit the spot. Kids loved the mashed and roasted potatoes.

e5S4hEVc8TkCDHkK8aQncA.text: Small restaurant located in covent market. It's a must when visiting London. They offer a variety of pies such as steak & kidney, chicken & mushroom, steak... We had the above mentioned pies and it was delish. As a side we had rocket salad aka arugula salad, light and refreshing.Would definitely recommend

Z6V1aOa3JxdI2AfKsR7RYA.text: I was excited to finally try Battersea Pie but I was met with disappointment. Hours posted that they open at 11am. We arrived at noon and the shop was closed. We were told they would open in 10 minuets so we waited. About 12:18 they finally opened without apology.    The beef and stout pie had a cardboard rigid crust. The filling to their credit was large pieces of beef but only filling about a third of the pie. The filling has no seasoning. It took salt, pepper and gravy to make it enjoyable. The minty peas were hard and nearly warm without any minty flavor or scent. All in all, far from bad but very short of good or worth a return visit.

Lz6u_JAemD4rK6TZnlzwhg.text: Great meat pies. Love the peas. Ok mashed potato. Located inside a shopping strip so pretty easy access in the middle of everything.  Reasonably priced. Will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom

DNkENsPdwEp6ggJT3-XJcA.text: The pies here are very crispy and flaky, and full of meat. The seating is a little cramped, not good at all for big groups, but a bit cozy feeling. The food comes out fast and the hot. The mashed potatoes were a bit of a disappointment, having a gummy sort of consistency.  Overall a good little shop in the middle of a cramped mall.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom

goJr13f6728Wm207uVuoAA.text: Absolutely loved this place. My boyfriend came here 2 years ago so when we passed through Covent Garden last week he said we HAD to stop because they were the best meat pies he'd ever had.  Well... we ended up going twice! I was also in London a few years ago and learned the hard way that my mushroom allergy & meat pies don't mix (my face looked like a fireball). Alas, when I walked in to Battersea Pie & asked if they were all made with mushrooms, only the specified Chicken & Mushroom was and they assured me I was safe to eat anything else. I had the Steak & Stout pie, while Michael had the Minced Beef & Onion. They were so incredibly delicious.  The crust is so perfect and the flavors just unfold into your mouth.  I loved it. The second visit we had on this trip was on our last day.  We had a late afternoon flight and came here for a quick bite before the airport.  When we came in a few days earlier I noticed a Butternut Squash & Goat Cheese pie that I was going to order to avoid mushrooms.  It had been on my mind so I ordered that and Michael got the special "Ginger Pig" Bangers & Mash.  Obviously much different orders and we did both wish we had reordered the same from the other day, but the food was still delicious.  My pie tasted like Thanksgiving.  It was a little different than I expected.  It had chunked squash & onions but was very good.  Michael's special was also delicious, the potatoes were great and adding a little of that Colman's Mustard is the perfect touch.  Will definitely go back next time we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom

StLvpTGcM4o6VEo9lAStmg.text: After being a tourist all day, I was in desperate need of a fast but delicious dinner. My pie hit the spot!Small place, but not too busy around dinner time. They have a variety of pies to choose from and they all come with a side of your choice. I chose the chicken pie with mashed potatoes as my side. The mashed potatoes were a little dry, but the pie was flaky and flavorful!It's in a great location, right in the center of Covent Garden. Battersea is a must try for a traditional pie and mash!

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. My chicken pie with mashed potatoes and gravy. YUM

lAnxog-N1pz79M_j5eVDmQ.text: When I moved to London, I thought, 'I may become slightly British but I will never like pie & mash.' I was wrong.Battersea offers arguably some of the best pie in London, and is a great gateway into the world of pie & mash for a skeptical Yank like myself. The butternut squash & goat cheese pie is my favorite, and those mashed potatoes... like curling up under a warm blanket on a rainy day. Rich, delicious, and comforting. I'm still thinking about them.

HqUwgY_wN69jk7hdugTL9w.text: Really amazing pie! Great for a rainy and cold day. Tried the steak and kidney pie and it came with gravy.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom

-LmlA8lZqdVhPJJSFdSMDg.text: Battersea Pies has a great selection of meat pies at pretty low prices (£7/pie)! They offer takeaway (which is cheaper) but there are plenty of seats inside and outside in Covent Garden. We tried all 5 of their pies: Steak & Meantime Stout, Chicken & Mushroom, Mince Beef & Onion, the Winstone (Steak & Kidney) and Butternut Squash & Goat's Cheese. I have to say my favorite was the butternut one, but all of them were flavorful and absolutely delicious!

R36uE6SH989xYIo7ccqeFA.text: The best pies and pasty's. Service was good, fast and efficient. Food did not disappoint.

3p8I8WjrHFPkcAD9IzcZUw.text: Can't really say the Pasty here is really any better than what you find at many tube stops or rail stations. This just seems to be a representation of this food category at Covent Garden.

qx6O788LiKN3pR1_7rCuzg.text: A cute little pie shop in Covent garden. It rekindled my love for pies. Had a couple London ales and a scrumptious pie that reminded me of my childhood. It was definitely a Ratatouille moment.I love the warm taste of chicken pot pies - the way the meats complement the delicate crust is just something I can never tire of. Maybe I'm just a little biased because of my love for pies,  but this place was pretty great.

9NLxttgeGUEs_okLI0DdRQ.text: Came here after reading Yelp reviews. The place is cute and very clean. The staff was very friendly and the prices were fair. I had the steak and stout pie with mashed potatoes. My friend had the butternut squash pie with green beans and potatoes. Everything tasted amazing! My plate came out really late so they gave us free brownies and extra potatoes. Great customer service. Highly recommend coming here!

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Steak and Stout Pie

UxXWcFmxqpplCnf3NAHWOw.text: Visitor to London and found this cute pie shop tucked away in the lower floor of the Covent Market. It looked awesome as we walked in, and the food lived up to it! Your traditional British meat lies with sides like creamy mash available (and worth getting). The special drink for the day was a lemon mint iced tea and it was incredible! Pricing was fair (~6£ for a pie) and there was a vegetarian option as well!! Would definitely recommend this place to anyone!!

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Inside

pbaVfzT0Q_FDSciFTtp01w.text: Superb "classic" British meal. Not that I would know anything about good places to get British food at, but this place was fantastic!If you're looking for a quick and easy place to experience a meat pie and mash, this is a great spot.

tHeaS8F2rbpYLAvSBzq7FQ.text: This a a small space with limited seating. I would say two people with shopping bags max. Truly. There was a table that seated four but it was a squeeze. With that being said the pies are worth it. I had the meat with stout pie and chicken mushroom pie.The chicken and mushroom pie was traditional so if you're not sure what to get or want to play it safe, I'd say get this. Really creamy and delicious.My husband got the Steak and Meantime Stout Pie. Lovely! The Meantime gives it a slightly smokey or oaky taste. Highly recommend this!Each pie was very filling and a great way to take a quick break from the chaos of Covent Garden.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and mushroom with mashed potatoes

6LDKMNk1-FMEKEQjYS4fqg.text: Delicious flaky-pastry traditional British pies and mashed potatoes in busy Covent Garden are on offer here, great for a late Sunday lunch while walking around London. We tried the steak and stout pie with mash. Filling was very flavorful,  with large chunks of tender steak in a stout gravy studded with sweet onion. The puff pastry was done perfectly -- not heavy at all. Mashed potatoes were buttery, smooth, and moist. The mini butternut squash and goat cheese pie surprised us with how well-balanced it was. We had expected the goat cheese to overpower the delicate squash, but the squash held its own and lent a delicious earthy sweetness to the savoury filling. We are glad to have found the Battersea Pie company -- 5 stars!!

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Eat outside the restaurant and watch the people go by :) a free show
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Gorgeous pastry on the steak pie
Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom. Steak pie and mash

Xs2B8n9-LMiwikA4cd7Pbg.text: Nice pie shop tucked away. I had a chicken and mushroom pie and it was yummm. I find it weird that you have to pay a different price to eat in than take away.... but thats England.

xJRAfCcQ6gng1oJ2nEaB4w.text: Had the mini chicken and mushroom pie. Delicious! It came with some gravy to drizzle on. The crust was baked just right with the good amount of flakeyness for pies. There were lots of flavors to choose from. Some seats inside and they also offer free wifi. It costs a little more if you choose to dine in. Definitely stop by if you are in covent garden!

nUzUrx9jE_txYmYCNkyf3w.text: Resist the large Shake Shack's temptation and go downstairs to try the British specialty - meat pie! As one of the classic British food recommended by a friend, Battersea is a great choice to try.Located on the below-ground level of Covent Garden, Battersea Pie is surprisingly reasonably priced and the portion is bigger than I thought. With plenty of choices, it would be hard not to find your true calling. Whichever you choose, the pie is truly filled with a generous amount of meat and - I pray you - do not expect this to be merely a snack because it could fill you up as a meal!Anyway, if you are around Covent Garden, definitely go downstairs and pick up a meat pie to eat! Take-out option will save you 1 GBP from regular price.

photos.caption: Photo of Battersea Pie - London, United Kingdom
